title: Investment Fund
description: Represents an investment fund entity, detailing its characteristics, status, and any associated verifiable presentations like social scores.

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier for the investment fund.

did.title: DID
did.description: Distributed Identifier of the investment fund.

createdAt.title: Creation Timestamp
createdAt.description: The timestamp when the investment fund was created.

updatedAt.title: Update Timestamp
updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the investment fund was last updated.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: The publicly visible name of the investment fund.

capitalCommitment.title: Capital Commitment
capitalCommitment.description: The total amount of capital committed to the investment fund.

status.title: Contract Lifecycle Status
status.description: An enumeration that represents the various lifecycle stages of a smart contract on the blockchain.
status.$comment: CREATE: Drafting, off-chain. | FREEZE: Deployed but halted. | EXECUTE: Active and operational. | FINALIZE: Nearing end of life. | PAUSED: Temporarily stopped. | COMPLETED: Finished execution. | DEPRECATED: No longer in use.

lp.title: Limited Partner
lp.description: The one/ones there provided the commited capital

gp.title: General Partner
gp.description: The one/ones there manage how the capital should be allocated.

advisor.title: Advisor
advisor.description: The one/ones there has the resposibilty for the fund and if the GP isnt the same as the advisor, then the GP will be working on behalf of the advisor.

start.title: Execute at
start.description: Represents the exact/earliest start time to trigger 'EXECUTE' of the fund contract. This is a non-nullable field that uses a custom scalar type 'Timestamp' to represent the time in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch as a string. If the execution is to start immediately after the 'FREEZE' event, a past date should be used. e.g. start: 1111111111111,

duration.title: Lifespan
duration.description: Represents the lifetime of the fund, defined with an ISO 8601 Duration string. For example, 'P30D' denotes a period of 30 days. This is a non-nullable field, meaning that a duration value must always be provided.

extended.title: Entended
extended.description: Indicates whether the fund's lifespan has been extended beyond its original duration.

endType.title: End Date Basis
endType.description: Defines the termination timing of the investment fund.
endType.$comment: 'EXACT' means ending exactly at 'start' + 'duration'. 'FISCAL' aligns the end with the fiscal year's end, and 'YEAR' aligns with the calendar year's end.

allocation.title: Allocation definitions
allocation.description: Defines the set conditions and criteria for fund allocations, including the allocation instrument, method, fundee type, expiration period, and other conditions. If an expiration duration is set, the fundee needs to claim the allocated funds within the period determined by 'createdAt' plus the 'expiration' duration.

instrument.title: Allocation Instrument
instrument.description: The instruments or methods available for allocating funds.

method.title: Allocation Method
method.description: Represents the methods by which the fund allocates its resources.
method.$comment: 'AUTOMATED': Allocation based on predefined criteria and algorithm. 'COMMITTEE': Allocation decisions made by a group through deliberation and consensus.

fundeeType.title: Fundee type
fundeeType.description: Determines the type of fundee (e.g., individual, organization) eligible for the allocation.

expiration.title: Expire after
expiration.description: The duration after which an unclaimed allocation will expire. The expiration period starts from 'createdAt' at the allocation object and lasts for the specified duration.

distance.title: Fund Allocation Scope
distance.description: Defines the diverse scopes for fund allocation, encompassing geographical areas, industry sectors, networks, and organizational entities. This attribute facilitates targeted allocation strategies, such as channeling capital to specific industries, supporting networks in smart city infrastructures, or focusing on distinct geographical regions. It enables precise and strategic distribution of funds across various dimensions and contexts.

boundry.title: Boundary Identifier
boundry.description: Uniquely identifies the target area or entity for fund allocation. This ID can represent various allocation scopes such as specific geographic regions, industry sectors, or network segments.

boundryType.title: Boundary Type
boundryType.description: Defines the category of the allocation boundary. Includes options like internal, local, regional, national, industry-specific, or network-based, offering flexibility in targeting fund distribution to diverse and strategic areas.
boundryType.$comment: Describes the scope of fund allocation boundaries. 'INTERNAL': Within an entity. 'LOCAL': City-level. 'REGIONAL': Larger areas like boroughs. 'NATIONAL': Country or state level. 'INDUSTRY': Specific industry sectors. 'NETWORK': Global networks, location-independent.

allocationRatio.title: Allocation Ratio
allocationRatio.description: Specifies the proportion of funds allocated to a particular boundary. This ratio is crucial for balancing the distribution of funds across various categories, ensuring that each area or sector receives an allocation in line with its strategic importance or operational needs.
